name: ClassBuilder.FieldBuilder
description: A specialized builder for creating and configuring fields within generated classes.
overview: The ClassBuilder.FieldBuilder class is a specialized builder for creating and configuring fields within generated classes. This builder provides a fluent API for setting field visibility, modifiers, initialization values, annotations, and other field properties, allowing you to create comprehensive field definitions. FieldBuilder instances are obtained through the addField() methods of ClassBuilder and support both simple field creation and advanced initialization with complex field initializers.

methods.name: makePublic
methods.description: Sets the field visibility to public. Public fields are accessible from any class. This is the default visibility if no other modifier is specified.

methods.name: makePrivate
methods.description: Sets the field visibility to private. Private fields are only accessible within the declaring class.

methods.name: makeProtected
methods.description: Sets the field visibility to protected. Protected fields are accessible within the same package and by subclasses.

methods.name: makeStatic
methods.description: Makes the field static (class-level rather than instance-level). All instances share the same static field value.

methods.name: makeFinal
methods.description: Makes the field final (constant). Final fields can only be assigned once and must be initialized either in declaration or in constructor.

methods.name: makeVolatile
methods.description: Makes the field volatile (thread-safe visibility). Volatile fields provide visibility guarantees across threads.

methods.name: makeTransient
methods.description: Makes the field transient (excluded from serialization). Transient fields are ignored during object serialization.

methods.name: setInitializer
methods.description: Sets a simple initialization value for the field. Value type must match the field type.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The initialization value (string, number, boolean, null)

methods.name: buildInitializer
methods.description: Creates a FieldInitializerBuilder for complex field initialization expressions (method calls, constructors, computed values).

methods.name: addAnnotation
methods.description: Adds an annotation to the field.

methods.name: end
methods.description: Finalizes the field and returns to the parent ClassBuilder. This method must be called to apply the field to the class.
